p: Phycobiliproteins are commercially used in foods, nutraceuticals, cosmetics as a colorant and for their therapeutic value, namely their antimicrobial, antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, neuroprotective, hepatoprotective, immunomodulating and anticarcinogenic properties [ 16, 194, 195, 196, 197, 198, 199, 200, 201]. They can improve the efficacy of standard anticancer drugs, lower their side effects [ 202] and act as photosensitizers for the treatment of tumoral cells [ 203]. They are also used as fluorescent markers in clinical diagnostics and immunological analysis.
